DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to examine the efficacy of prophylactic antibiotics in patients with chest tubes for management of thoracic injuries in the reduction of the incidence of empyema as compared to placebo.
DOC.brief_title: Role of Antibiotics to Reduce Infectious Complications in Tube Thoracotomy Management of Traumatic Hemopneumothorax
DOC.detailed_description: In this study, the medication (an antibiotic which is used to treat or prevent infections) will be compared with a placebo. A placebo is something that looks like a "real" medication, but it doesn't contain any active medication. As a participant in this study, you may receive the active medication (Cefazolin Sodium Injection or Clindamycin) or you may receive a placebo.
